org.matrix.olm

Class OlmInboundGroupSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.olm.CommonSerializeUtils
      • org.matrix.olm.OlmInboundGroupSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class OlmInboundGroupSession
extends CommonSerializeUtils
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used to create an inbound Megolm session.
    Counter part of the outbound group session OlmOutboundGroupSession, this class decrypts the messages sent by the outbound side.

    Detailed implementation guide is available at Implementing End-to-End Encryption in Matrix clients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • OlmInboundGroupSession

        public OlmInboundGroupSession(java.lang.String aSessionKey)
                       throws OlmException
        Constructor.
        Create and save a new native session instance ID and start a new inbound group session. The session key parameter is retrieved from an outbound group session.
        Parameters:
        aSessionKey - session key
        Throws:
        OlmException - constructor failure

      • OlmInboundGroupSession

        private OlmInboundGroupSession(java.lang.String aSessionKey,
                               boolean isImported)
                        throws OlmException
        Constructor.
        Create and save a new native session instance ID and start a new inbound group session. The session key parameter is retrieved from an outbound group session.
        Parameters:
        aSessionKey - session key
        isImported - true when the session key has been retrieved from a backup
        Throws:
        OlmException - constructor failure

    • Method Detail

      • createNewSessionJni

        private long createNewSessionJni(byte[] aSessionKeyBuffer,
                                 boolean isImported)
        Initialize a new inbound group session and return it to JAVA side.
        Since a C prt is returned as a jlong, special care will be taken to make the cast (OlmInboundGroupSession* to jlong) platform independent.
        Parameters:
        aSessionKeyBuffer - session key from an outbound session
        isImported - true when the session key has been retrieved from a backup
        Returns:
        the initialized OlmInboundGroupSession* instance or throw an exception it fails.

        Returns:
        the created OlmException

      • releaseSession

        public void releaseSession()
        Release native session and invalid its JAVA reference counter part.
        Public API for releaseSessionJni().

      • releaseSessionJni

        private void releaseSessionJni()
        Destroy the corresponding OLM inbound group session native object.
        This method must ALWAYS be called when this JAVA instance is destroyed (ie. garbage collected) to prevent memory leak in native side. See createNewSessionJni(byte[], boolean).

        public boolean isReleased()
        Return true the object resources have been released.
        Returns:
        true the object resources have been released

      • serialize

        protected byte[] serialize(byte[] aKey,
                           java.lang.StringBuffer aErrorMsg)
        Return the current inbound group session as a bytes buffer.
        The session is serialized and encrypted with aKey. In case of failure, an error human readable description is provide in aErrorMsg.
        Specified by:
        serialize in class CommonSerializeUtils
        Parameters:
        aKey - encryption key
        aErrorMsg - error message description
        Returns:
        pickled bytes buffer if operation succeed, null otherwise

      • serializeJni

        private byte[] serializeJni(byte[] aKey)
        JNI counter part of serialize(byte[], StringBuffer).
        Parameters:
        aKey - encryption key
        Returns:
        the serialized session

      • deserializeJni

                            byte[] aKey)
        Allocate a new session and initialize it with the serialisation data.
        An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Parameters:

        aKey - the key used to encrypt the serialized account data
        Returns:
